channel.title: Defectprevention on Becoming a better Tester!
channel.description: Recent content in Defectprevention on Becoming a better Tester!

item.title: Finding Defects V s Preventing Defects
item.description: Finding defects involves verifying after the software is created. Fixing defects involves re-doing the faulty code and then re-testing everything to ensure that the fix is in place and that nothing else got broken. This takes time and money. Preventing defects is easier, and needn’t take a lot of upfront analysis either if certain practices are followed. Prevention is better than cure. Preventing the defects before the product is built (coding phase) helps deliver business value earlier.
